meanings.definition: The quality or state of being characteristic of the common people or a particular community.
meanings.sent1: The folkishness of the small town was evident in their annual harvest festival.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the folkishness of the local music scene.
meanings.sent3: The folkishness of the neighborhood potluck brought everyone together.
meanings.sent4: His paintings captured the essence of folkishness in rural life.
meanings.sent5: The folkishness of the village was like a warm embrace to newcomers.

meanings.definition: The belief in or promotion of traditional customs, beliefs, and values of a particular group.
meanings.sent1: Their folkishness led them to celebrate ancient rituals passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: The preservation of folkishness was important to the cultural heritage of the tribe.
meanings.sent3: The folkishness of their family traditions made holidays extra special.
meanings.sent4: In his speech, he emphasized the importance of folkishness in maintaining identity.
meanings.sent5: The folkishness of their ceremonies connected them to their ancestors.
